sport.name: 100m Sprint
sport.description: The 100m sprint is a short-distance race in which athletes run as fast as possible over a straight 100-meter track.

rules.rule: Each race consists of eight lanes, and each athlete must remain in their lane.
False starts result in automatic disqualification.
The winner is the athlete who crosses the finish line first.

sport.name: Marathon
sport.description: The marathon is a long-distance race with an official distance of 42.195 kilometers, usually run as a road race.

rules.rule: The marathon is run on roads but can finish on a track or stadium.
Competitors must cover the entire distance by running or walking.
The winner is the first runner to cross the finish line after completing the full distance.

sport.name: 100m Freestyle
sport.description: The 100m freestyle is a swimming race where athletes swim two lengths of a 50-meter pool using any stroke, but the front crawl is the fastest and most common stroke.

rules.rule: Swimmers must touch the wall at the end of each lap.
The start is from a diving platform, and false starts result in disqualification.
The winner is the swimmer who touches the wall first at the end of the race.

sport.name: 4x100m Medley Relay
sport.description: The 4x100m medley relay is a team swimming event where each of four swimmers performs a different stroke: backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly, and freestyle, in that order.

rules.rule: Each swimmer must complete their stroke before the next swimmer dives in.
Backstroke starts in the water, while other strokes begin from the platform.
False starts or stroke infractions lead to disqualification.

sport.name: 100m Freestyle
sport.description: The 100m freestyle for swimmers is a short-distance race where athletes swim two lengths of a 50-meter pool as fast as possible, typically using the front crawl stroke.

rules.rule: Swimmers must touch the wall at the end of each lap.
The start is from a diving platform, and false starts result in disqualification.
The winner is the swimmer who touches the wall first at the end of the race.

sport.name: 4x100m Freestyle Relay
sport.description: The 4x100m freestyle relay for swimmers is a team event where each of the four swimmers swims 100 meters using the freestyle stroke, with a focus on speed and teamwork.

rules.rule: Each swimmer must touch the wall before the next swimmer begins.
False starts or infractions on the changeover lead to disqualification.
The winning team is the first to complete all four legs of the race.

sport.name: 200m Butterfly
sport.description: The 200m butterfly is a race where swimmers swim four lengths of a 50-meter pool using the butterfly stroke.

rules.rule: The butterfly stroke must be used throughout the race.
Swimmers must touch the wall with both hands at each turn and at the finish.
The winner is determined by the fastest time.
